result.execSummary:
The defendant Lacy R. Storkson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions: 

Attend, pay for and successfully complete all assessments/educational programming as recommended by agent. 

Pay costs of action and costs of probation (one set of costs).

Defendant is to submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs for Count 2 are clerk-collect as Count 2 is a non-probation count.  DOC to refer to the Assessment Report for a breakdown on the amounts owed in this case.  Clerk of Court shall use all statutorily-available means to collect this debt.

Consecutive to any sentence currently being served.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lacy R. Storkson in court with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached resolution. Plea questionnaire/waiver submitted. Plea agreement recited. Colloquy. NC plea entered to counts 1 & 2. Factual basis found. Court accepts pleas, finds def guilty to counts 1 & 2. Comment on sentencing. Firearm prohibition given/voting rights admonishment.

Sentencing: 

Ct. 1: 3 years probation, imposed and stayed 180 days jail. Attend, pay for and successfully complete all assessments/educational programming as recommended by agent. Pay costs of action and costs of probation (one set of costs). 

Ct. 2: fine/forf of $1694, 65 days jail consecutive to any sentence being served, 24 month license revocation, 2 year IID, AODA assessment and DSP upon relicensing, $66 restitution to Sheriff's dept for blood draw. 60 dtp. 

Ct 3 & 4 dismissed and read in.

Defendant Lacy R. Storkson in court, in custody (from separate, revoked case), with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  15CF52 and 15CF82/status and adjourned initial, respectively.  In both, Atty. B advises the Court that the def will waive her right to prelim.  Court's colloquy on prelim waiver.  Prelims waived.  Counsel indicate that they are ready to proceed to arraignment as DA will be carrying forth the original charges to the information.  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  Atty. B - def stands mute for entry of NG pleas in both cases.  Atty. B requests further status same date/time as def's other matters.  Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.
email request for rescheduling from Atty B.

Defendant Lacy R. Storkson in court with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Formal reading waived.  Prelim time limits waived.  Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Must submit to testing of blood, breath or urine on demand by law enforcement to monitor compliance. Defendant is not to ingest, inhale or consume any substance that is illegal without a valid prescription.

Defendant Lacy R. Storkson appeared by video means. Attorney Peter A. Bartelt via telephone for Defendant Lacy R. Storkson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court informs def of the charges/max possible penalties. Request for signature bond by defense. DA does not object to reduction of cash bond. Court will modify bond to $10K signature bond, PBT upon request of demand of law enforcement, not to ingest, inhale or consume any substance that is illegal without a valid prescription.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
